Rented Devices are Altice Equipment as defined in the General Terms and Conditions of Service (Residential) and General Terms and Conditions of Service (Business) (for Optimum residential and business subscribers, respectively) (the “Optimum Terms”) and Residential Service Agreement and Commercial Service Agreement (for Suddenlink residential and business customers, respectively) (the “Suddenlink Terms”), which are incorporated herein by reference. The Device is Amazon Alexa enabled. Your use of Alexa functionality through the Device is subject to applicable third party terms of use. Use of the Altice One Skill via the Device is subject to the Altice One Skill Terms of Use (for Optimum Customers), the Altice One Skill Terms of Use (for Suddenlink Subscribers), the Optimum App Privacy Notice (for Optimum subscribers), and the Suddenlink App Privacy Notice (for Suddenlink customers), each of which are also incorporated herein by reference.

Notwithstanding any other provision of these Terms to the contrary, these Terms shall not be deemed to apply to any Third Party Software and such Third Party Software is subject to the terms and conditions of the license agreement between Customer and the licensor of the Third Party Software.

Customer may not decompile, reverse engineer, translate, disassemble, modify, port, translate, copy, reproduce, duplicate, distribute, create derivative works of the Device and Set-Up App or in any way derive, reconstruct, identify or discover from the Device and Set-Up App any source code, underlying ideas, or algorithms by any means. Except in the event of a Purchased Device, Customer agrees not to sell, lease, license, sublicense, distribute, assign, transfer or otherwise grant any rights to the Device and Set-Up App. Customer agrees not to remove, alter, or obscure any product identification, proprietary, copyright, or other intellectual property notices, labels or marks contained or embedded within or on the Device and Set-Up App. Further, Customer may not, directly or indirectly, incorporate the Device and Set-Up App into Customer's products or software. Customer may not use the Device and Set-Up App in an attempt to circumvent technological measures implemented to control the rights to and access and use of any content, files or other material made available in or through the Device and Set-Up App.

Customer represents and warrants that Customer is not located in a country that is subject to a US government embargo, or that has been designated by the US government as a "terrorist" supporting country, and that Customer is not listed in any US government lists of prohibited or restricted parties.

We recommend that You password-protect Your home router to enhance the security of Your home wireless network, Use of this Device and Set-Up App may involve the use of a wireless data service. Customer understands and agrees that Altice is not responsible for any data access charges that may be imposed by Customer's underlying wireless data service provider when using the data service.

Privacy Policy and Information Practices.

COLLECTION: We collect two different types of information related to You as a result of your purchase, rental and use and our provisioning of the Device: Personal Information and Device Specific Information (collectively, “Information”).

"Personal Information" means information that We directly associate with a specific person or entity, for example, name, mailing addresses, telephone number, email address, and payment information. Personal information does not include "de-identified,” or "aggregate" information that is not linked or reasonably linkable to a specific person. When You rent or purchase a Device, We will use your Personal Information in order to process the transaction. Once your Device is shipped, We will associate your Device with a unique identifier, which is then used to identify your Device, and is thereafter associated with the Device Specific Information that We automatically collect, as further described below.

“Device Specific Information” means, as further described below, the Device Data, Performance Data, Activity Data, and Audio Data that is related to a Device, which We automatically collect in order to provide the requested functionality and fulfill the agreement We have with You. “Device Data” means information related to device type, device identifiers, operating system, software version, content source (audio line in), information about WiFi antennas, audio settings (such as equalization or stereo pair), the names You have given your Device in different rooms, and error information. “Performance Data” means and includes information related to the temperature of your device, WiFi information like signal strength, information about how often You use the Set-Up App versus other control mechanisms, flow of interactions within the Device and Set-Up App, and duration of Device use. “Activity Data” means and includes duration of music service use, application or room grouping information, command information (such as play, pause, change volume, or skip tracks), and information about track. each correlated to the individual Device. “Audio Data” which means and includes any sounds, noises, voices, speech or other audio at each frequency. Details regarding collection, use and disclosure of Audio Data are provided below.

USE: We may use your Information to: 1) fulfill our Agreement with You. 2) secure and improve the Device and Set-Up App. 3) provide customer and technical support. 4) prevent fraud, and ensure uninterrupted use of the Device and Set-Up App. 5) bill and collect any applicable fees or charges. 6) provide You service-related communications about the Device and Set-Up App. 7) inform You about changes to your Device, the Set-Up App, this Privacy Policy, and other terms that apply to our services. 8) ensure compliance with applicable laws and the terms, conditions, notices and policies governing the use of your Device. and 9) update any programs or other tools that We provide in conjunction with your Device.

We may also disclose Your Information as required by law or to protect Altice and others. These disclosures may be made with or without Your consent, and with or without notice, in compliance with the terms of valid legal process such as a subpoena, court order, or search warrant. If Altice is required to disclose Information that identifies You to a private third party in response to a civil court order, We will notify You prior to making such disclosure unless legally prohibited from doing so.

We may also disclose Information when we believe in good faith that the disclosure of such information is necessary to enforce our rights under our terms of service and policies, address suspected illegal activity, secure our services or network, protect our rights or property, or in emergency situations to prevent imminent physical harm.

Collection, Use and Disclosure of Audio Data: Your Device is not continuously capturing sound in your home. Your Device only captures sound and other audio recordings when You enable voice control technology on your Device. Voice control works by your Device “listening” for a key wake-up word. This “listening” means that your Device buffers and re-records locally, without transmitting or storing any information, until it detects the word or phrase (such as “Alexa”) that triggers the Device to begin actively recording. If your Device does not detect the wake-up word, it continues to record over itself in a never-ending loop lasting a few seconds. This is all done locally on your Device and is not sent to Altice or any third party. If a wake-up word is detected, your Device begins recording. It does not record or retain any audio data, or begin to transmit any data until it is “woken up.” You are notified that it is recording by a visual element, such as a light on the Device, and a specific sound. Your Device will record until your voice command is finished. The actual recording of your voice command is then sent to the voice partner You have authorized to receive such recording (for example, Amazon). Altice does not retain a copy of your voice recording.

SECURITY: We employ physical, electronic, and procedural safeguards to protect Information. Despite these measures, We do not guarantee the security of information stored in our database or that unauthorized parties will not intercept information you send or receive over the Internet. As a shared resource, the Internet subjects our services and you to the risk of unauthorized access to files and data, even when security measures are implemented.

We will retain Information for as long as your account is active or as otherwise necessary to fulfill our agreement with you, help us improve our products and services, comply with our legal obligations and/or resolve disputes.

Support is an optional monthly plan available to current residential Optimum and Suddenlink Subscribers which includes (a) technical support services for certain home entertainment devices within your immediate household ("Support Services"), (b) access to a protection plan for certain qualifying home entertainment products against failure due to breakdown ("Protection Plan"), and (c) access to the Premier Protection &. Support mobile application for Optimum Subscribers only ("Support App"). The Support Services, Protection Plan and Support App may be referred to, collectively, as "HEPS," the "Services" or the "HEPS Plan."

This Acceptable Use Policy ("AUP") has been created to promote the integrity, security, reliability, and privacy of Altice's Internet Product Network (the "Service"). The AUP works in conjunction with the Terms of Service ("TOS") of each particular product as set forth in each Agreement for service and specifies actions that are prohibited by users of the Service. The Service may be used only for lawful purposes. Transmission or distribution of any material in violation of any applicable law or regulation is prohibited. This includes, without limitation, material protected by copyright, trademark, trade secret, or other intellectual property right used without proper authorization, and material that is obscene, illegal, defamatory, constitutes an illegal threat, or violates export control laws. Altice maintains a zero-tolerance policy on Spam for all of its Internet products and will take immediate action against users violating this AUP. The Services may not be used to collect responses from unsolicited communication regardless of the communication's origination. Moreover, unsolicited communication may not direct the recipient to any web site or other resource that uses the Service and the user may not reference the Service in the header or by listing an IP address that belongs to the Service in any unsolicited communication even if that communication is not sent through the Service or its infrastructure.

Users may not send any type of communication to any individual who has indicated that he/she does not wish to receive messages from them. Continuing to send email messages to anyone that has expressly requested not to receive email from a User is considered to be harassment.
 

USENET/Internet Chat

Users may not SPAM newsgroups or chat rooms and must comply with the written charters, FAQs, rules, or terms of service for those forums the user chooses to participate. Users are responsible for determining the policies of a given group/room before posting to it. Additionally, Users are not permitted to:

Abusable Resources
